description: Erection of single storey rear extension to create a self-contained one-bedroom residential unit
decision_conditions: It has not been demonstrated to the satisfaction of the Local Planning Authority that the proposed arrangement whereby the existing occupants of the first floor flat at 92 Burlington Road, New Malden KT3 4NT would have to walk across the flat roof of the proposed dwelling would not give rise to unreasonable noise and disturbance for future occupants. The proposal would therefore be contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Policy 7.15 of the London Plan (2016) and  Policy DM10 of the adopted Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012).

In the absence of a legal agreement to ensure that future occupants of the proposed development would be precluded from obtaining on-street car parking permits, the proposed development would lead to inconsiderate parking and increase on-street car parking pressure and congestion in surrounding streets.  As such, the proposal is considered to conflict with the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Policy 6.13 of the London Plan (2016) and Policies DM9 and DM10 of the adopted Local Development Framework Core Strategy (2012).

The proposed development would result in a significantly substandard form of accommodation for future occupants, in terms of outlook, internal floorspace and external amenity.  The proposal would therefore be contrary to the National Planning Policy Framework (2019), Policy 3.5 of the London Plan (2016), Policy DM10 of the adopted Core Strategy (2012) and Policy Guidance 13 of the Council's Residential Design Guide Supplementary Planning Document (2013).
Condition 21 (Ventilation) - RBK Environmental Health Officer has reviewed the information provided and is satisfied this can now be approved.

The applicant is informed that the submitted details, as set out above are agreed and that Condition 21 (Ventilation) of planning permission 20/00702/FUL is hereby fully approved subject to carrying out the development in accordance with the details hereby approved.

The assessment of this application is based on measurements taken from the submitted drawings / plans.
